nodes.bodyText: Hm, ... shouldn't the value be annotated by @Nullable then?

That makes sense and if we keep allowing null values the Map value type in protected void updateProperties(Map<String, String> properties) should also be properly annotated. I don't know how common it is for properties to be nullable. Another way could be to add a removeProperty method so we can rid of keys with null values. But updateProperties would also have to be updated for that and I don't know how breaking all these API changes would be. 😉
